\normalsectionstart{Overview}
Soil Scientist and Environmental Engineer engaged in research focused on digital soil mapping and
morphometrics. Working mainly with geoprocessing and proximal sensor research. Expert in portable
X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (pXRF) and Visible and Near-Infrared diffuse reflectance
spectroscopy (Vis-NIR DRS) applied to soil analyses. Developed award-winning scientific articles
about novel methods towards the use of proximal sensor data to assess and map soil attributes.
\normalsectionend

\multicolsectionstart{Skills and Highlights}{2}
 + Winner of the national award [Undergraduate Research Highlight
   Prize](https://www.gov.br/cnpq/pt-br/assuntos/noticias/premios/conheca-os-vencedores-da-18a-edicao-do-premio-destaque-na-iniciacao-cientifica-e-tecnologica-do-cnpq)
   from the National Council for Scientific and Technological Development
   (CNPq).

 + Knowledge and experience in data analysis using R and Python.

 + Basic knowledge in C++, Java, LaTeX and Bash.

 + Proficiency in statistical modeling applied to digital soil mapping.
 
 + Specialist in pXRF and Vis-NIR applied to soil assessment.

 + Expertise in digital soil mapping using geoprocessing tools (QGIS, GRASS, SAGA, R).

 + Large experience in scientific writing in both English and Portuguese.

 + Advanced English skills and intermediary Japanese skills.
